other_tests.findings: Plasma cortisol levels below normal response in sibling 2; maximal plasma cortisol concentration of 245 nmol/liter in sibling 1.
other_tests.changes_over_time: In sibling 1, cortisol levels were within the normal range for age; response in sibling 2 was below normal range.

other_tests.findings: Retrospectively found elevated levels of 17-OHP in blood spots.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Sibling 1 had 117 nmol/liter and sibling 2 had 143 nmol/liter (normal range <175 nmol/liter).

other_tests.findings: Sibling 1 presented with abnormal urine excretion of steroid metabolites: 12.88 mg per 24 h of pregnenetriol, 11.65 mg per 24 h of DHA metabolites, and 15.27 mg per 24 h of 17-OHP.
Both girls were compound heterozygotes for T181I and 1105delA mutations.
Siblings had elevated renin levels indicating compensated salt loss; 271 mIU/liter in sibling 1 and 1750 mIU/liter in sibling 2.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Plasma renin increased to 342 mIU/liter for sibling 2 after treatment.
